title: Augusta County: E. Lawson to E. P. Smith, October 1, 1867
summary: Rev. E. Lawson, pastor of the Colored Methodist Episcopal Church in Staunton, begins this communication to AMA administrator E. P. Smith by expressing his sadness over the removal of John Scott from his position with the AMA in Virginia. The central purpose of Lawson's letter, however, is to explain why he and his congregation refused to allow the AMA to hold a school in the main body of their church.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
